conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I’d be a strong fit for your community. I’d like to formally apply and would be excited to accept an offer if admitted. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). If I apply there now, I’m likely rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_D is my 2nd choice and ranks me 4th as well. By contrast, School_A is my 3rd choice but ranks me 1st, meaning an early application should be accepted immediately and lock in a solid outcome rather than risking rejection and ending up with a worse school later. Therefore I will apply to School_A now to secure a match.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and your interest in School_A. We’re pleased to offer you admission—welcome to School_A! We look forward to having you join our community.
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A's true priority list. They have applied in round 1 and we have quota 1 available. Accepting now secures our top-choice student and avoids the risk of losing them to another school (Student_E ranks School_A 3rd but could match elsewhere if not accepted). No higher-priority candidate exists, so immediate acceptance is optimal.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m strongly committed to attending if admitted, and I believe I would be a serious, reliable fit for your program and community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I am relatively high in School_B’s priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B), and delaying could let higher-ranked students take the only seat. An early, clear application maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before competition resolves elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your clear commitment and are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from C, D, and A. Among these, Student_C is the highest on my list. Although Student_E (my top) and Student_B (second) have not contacted me yet, I only have quota 1 and can secure a relatively high-priority match now by accepting C. Waiting risks losing Student_C to another school (C ranks School_B first, but could be taken if dynamics change), while D and A are lower priority for me. Therefore, accept Student_C now to lock in a better outcome than accepting D or A, even if it forecloses a chance at E or B later.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would immediately accept an offer. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 4th (behind E, B, C), early application is still my best shot at my highest true preference. If I delay, I risk losing the only seat to higher-priority applicants who also list School_B highly (especially Student_A and Student_C). I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and that School_B is my first choice.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission. We truly appreciate your commitment and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: My quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_C from prior acceptance, so per rules I must reject any new APPLY messages. Although Student_D is on my true priority list (ranked above Student_C), I cannot accept due to capacity constraints and cannot break an existing match. Therefore I must reject Student_D this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_B is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in the academic environment and the opportunities I’ve heard about there. I would be excited to contribute positively to the community and work hard if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances if others apply first. A direct, sincere application is best, and if rejected I can pivot to School_C next round.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission. We truly appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your other choices.
conversation.thought: Student_A applied, but School_B’s remaining quota is 0 and we are already matched with Student_C. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new APPLY regardless of priority. Student_A is also lowest on our true priority list, so even if a seat were available they would not outrank our current match.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B and I’m very interested in joining School_C. If admitted, I would take the offer seriously and commit to making the most of the opportunities at School_C. Thank you for considering my application.

School_C ranks me 1st, giving me an excellent chance to secure a strong match early. Since School_C is still my 3rd choice and I can likely lock it in now rather than risk ending up lower later, I will apply to School_C immediately and emphasize fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your interest in School_C. Based on your application and our admissions priorities, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you would be an excellent fit for our rigorous academic environment and school community.

We look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C’s true priority list. They have applied directly to us in round 1, and we have remaining quota 1. Accepting now guarantees our top-choice match and removes risk of losing them to School_A or School_B (both ranked above School_C in Student_B’s preferences). No higher-priority candidate exists for us, so immediate acceptance is optimal.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D. I’m writing to formally apply to School_E. After recent updates in the market, School_E is one of my top remaining choices, and I would be excited to join your community. If offered admission, I am prepared to accept immediately. A formal application is appropriate because seats are scarce and I want to lock in a match if possible. I will clearly signal strong interest and immediate acceptance if admitted.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranking is A > C > B > E > D. I have one seat. In this round I received applications from Student_D and Student_A. Student_A is my top choice overall and is explicitly willing to accept immediately, so accepting Student_D now would block a strictly better outcome. Therefore I should reject Student_D to preserve capacity for Student_A (and potentially Student_C/B if they appear later, but A is already here).

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. With School_B no longer available, School_E is my top remaining choice. I’m excited by the possibility of joining your community and I would gladly accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though ranked last). Also, School_D’s priority list ranks me #1, so an application should be successful if the seat is still open.
